posts.title: Mahjong
posts.excerpt: Review:Mahjong (1996) is in many ways Yang’s greatest Satire, but has, at the same time, the beating pulse of a real dramatic story. In plays on the perception of Taiwan by foreign entities, urban locales, love, father/son relationships, and of course, themes of business & greed that Yang most vehemently loathes. The story is told …

posts.title: Rachel, Rachel
posts.excerpt: Paul Newman made his directorial debut and Newman’s wife, Joanne Woodward, stars as Rachel Cameron, a 35-year-old unmarried schoolteacher who feels as though she’s wasted her life. Rachel’s best friend, Calla Mackie (Estelle Parsons), invites her to attend a religious revival meeting. Here Rachel is swept up in the emotional fervor orchestrated by a young …

posts._title: Catherine Binet – Les jeux de la Comtesse Dolingen de Gratz (1981)
posts.title: Les jeux de la Comtesse Dolingen de Gratz
posts.excerpt: Plot In Paris, a young woman, Louise Haines Pearson, visits her disturbed friend Nena who tells her that she has just written a book on the history of a little girl troubled by her senses, perhaps because of the tyranny of his mother and the absence of her father. Louise recognizes the difficulties of this …

posts.title: Motu Maeva
posts.excerpt: In a bird-warbling prologue, we skim over the green and dense water to reach an undefined piece of land, an old woman’s wonderful cobbled-up shelter, a timeless off-the-map place. Motu Maeva is the name of that island from where happy memories, as well as some others we guess are more painful, will spread out: a …

posts._title: Thom Andersen – The Tony Longo Trilogy (2014)
posts.title: The Tony Longo Trilogy
posts.excerpt: Although he has been limited to bit parts, actor Tony Longo is an axiom of American action cinema: the giant who is too softhearted for the job. Composed of three short movies, “Hey, Asshole!,” “Adam Kesher” and “You Fucking Dickhead!,” The Tony Longo Trilogy brings together all of the actor’s scenes in three of his …

posts._title: Jörg A. Hoppe & Heiko Lange & Klaus Maeck – B-Movie: Lust & Sound in West-Berlin 1979-1989 (2015)
posts.title: B-Movie: Lust & Sound in West-Berlin 1979-1989
posts.excerpt: Music, art and chaos in the wild West-Berlin of the 1980s. The walled-in city became the creative melting pot for sub- and pop-culture. Before the iron curtain fell, everything and anything seemed possible. B-MOVIE is a fast-paced collage of mostly unreleased film and TV footage from a frenzied but creative decade, starting with punk and …
posts.director: Jörg A Hoppe & Heiko Lange & Klaus Maeck

posts._title: Mitsuo Yanagimachi – Saraba itoshiki daichi AKA Farewell to the Land (1982)
posts.title: Saraba itoshiki daichi
posts.excerpt: Even though this film has (ofifcially) no involvement by Kenji Nakagami, it still feels totally like one of his stories. People familiar with his writings set in Wakayama will cerntainly recognize a couple of similarities. Eiga Geijutsu’s #2 for 1982. Jinpachi Nezu really delivers an outstanding performance that got him the Kinema Junpo Award for …

posts.title: Network
posts.excerpt: Quote: “Network” will shake you up. Paddy Chayefsky’s absurdly plausible and outrageously provocative original script concerns media running amok. Faye Dunaway and William Holden, each in two of their finest performances, plus Peter Finch and Robert Duvall star in this superbly cast and handsomely produced Howard Gottfried production. Sidney Lumet’s direction is outstanding. The Metro …

posts.title: Senilità
posts.excerpt: Based on Italo Svevo’s great novel so admired by James Joyce, this atmospherically photographed film is set in old Trieste and centers on a middle-aged public official and his unrequited love for a flirtatious but unpossessable girl who blithely betrays him. The melancholy hero is played by Anthony Franciosa; Claudia Cardinale is the girl. The …

posts.title: Apache
posts.excerpt: Apache was based on Paul I. Wellman’s novel Broncho Apache, which in turn was inspired by a true story. Burt Lancaster plays Massai, a lieutenant of the great Apache warrior Geronimo (here depicted as an old man, played by Monte Blue). Though his tribe has signed surrender terms with the conquering whites, Massai refuses to …
